meanings.definition: A person or thing that consolidates or combines things into a single unit.
meanings.sent1: The consolidators gathered all the scattered toys into one big box.
meanings.sent2: The teacher was the consolidator of all the students' ideas into a cohesive project.
meanings.sent3: The consolidators in the puzzle game made sure all the pieces fit perfectly.
meanings.sent4: She acted as the consolidator of the team's efforts, bringing everything together smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The consolidators in the kitchen combined all the ingredients to make a delicious cake.

meanings.definition: A company that acquires smaller companies to create a larger entity.
meanings.sent1: The consolidators in the business world bought many small firms to form a big corporation.
meanings.sent2: Investors were excited about the consolidators merging various companies under one umbrella.
meanings.sent3: The consolidators in the market seemed like puzzle masters putting together different pieces.
meanings.sent4: The idea of consolidators in the industry was like a giant magnet pulling in smaller businesses.
meanings.sent5: The consolidators' strategy was to unite all the smaller companies for greater success.
